title: Implement filter pipeline parsing (|>)
description:
Add filter support with pipeline operator |> for function calls like {{ value |> filter1 |> filter2 }}.

## Design Details

### Syntax
{{ value |> filter1 |> filter2(arg1, arg2) }}

### Core Concepts
- Pipeline operator |> chains filter functions left-to-right
- Filters are functions that take the previous result as first argument  
- Filters can accept additional arguments in parentheses
- Filters have access to template context for dynamic behavior

### Built-in Filters
- String: uppercase, lowercase, capitalize, truncate(length)
- Array/Object: length, first, last, reverse
- Utility: default(value), format(pattern)

### Implementation
- Filter registry: Global table of named filter functions
- Compile-time resolution: Look up filters by name during compilation
- Generated code: filter1(filter2(value, arg1), arg2)
- Error handling: Clear messages for undefined/invalid filters

### API
Template.register_filter(name, function)

title: Design template component system
description: Design the component-based template system that will make templates easy for AI to create and compose. Define component structure, registration, and usage patterns.
design:
Component-based template system design decisions:
- Components use Capital naming (Button, not button) to distinguish from HTML elements
- XML-style syntax: <Button class=\"primary\" text=\"Save\"/>
- Components inlined during compilation (no function call overhead)
- Template string registration API
- Top-level templates compile to single functions with everything inlined
- Self-closing syntax: <Button/> for simple components, <Button></Button> for content
- Compilation: Components become inline string concatenation in final function
- ERROR SEMANTICS: Compile-time validation of component names with clear error messages
- Validation: Registry lookup during compilation, suggests corrections for typos
acceptance_criteria: Design document completed with syntax specification

title: Implement complete inheritance chain resolution for multi-level template inheritance
description:
Fix multi-level template inheritance by resolving entire inheritance chains at compile time rather than level-by-level merging. This allows blocks to be properly overridden across multiple inheritance levels.

Current issue: Templates are processed level-by-level during registration, causing blocks to be expanded too early and preventing grandchild templates from overriding blocks defined in grandparents.

Solution: When compiling a template, build the complete inheritance chain, collect all block definitions across the chain, resolve final block content by walking the inheritance hierarchy, and generate the final compiled template with all blocks properly resolved.

This maintains eager evaluation while fixing inheritance semantics.</description>

handle_connection(application, raw_http_data)

## New Interface  
handle_connection(application, method, target, version, remaining_data)

2. C handles request line errors (400, 501, 505 responses)

4. Tests updated for new interface

title: Design template component system
description: Design the component-based template system that will make templates easy for AI to create and compose. Define component structure, registration, and usage patterns.
design:
Component-based template system design decisions:
- Components use Capital naming (Button, not button) to distinguish from HTML elements
- XML-style syntax: <Button class=\"primary\" text=\"Save\"/>
- Components inlined during compilation (no function call overhead)
- Template string registration API
- Top-level templates compile to single functions with everything inlined
- Self-closing syntax: <Button/> for simple components, <Button></Button> for content
- Compilation: Components become inline string concatenation in final function
- ERROR SEMANTICS: Compile-time validation of component names with clear error messages
- Validation: Registry lookup during compilation, suggests corrections for typos
acceptance_criteria: Design document completed with syntax specification
close_reason: Component system design completed
